00053 /*
00054  * Regular MGS handlers
00055  */
00056 static int mgs_connect(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00057 {
00058         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
00059         int                      rc;
00060 
00061         ENTRY;
00062 
00063         CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_MGS_CONNECT_NET, cfs_fail_val);
00064         rc = tgt_connect(tsi);
00065         if (rc)
00066                 RETURN(rc);
00067 
00068         if (lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg) > 1)
00069                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(req->rq_repmsg, MSG_CONNECT_RECONNECT);
00070 
00071         RETURN(0);
00072 }
00073 
00074 static int mgs_disconnect(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00075 {
00076         int rc;
00077 
00078         ENTRY;
00079 
00080         LASSERT(tsi->tsi_exp);
00081 
00082         rc = tgt_disconnect(tsi);
00083         if (rc)
00084                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
00085         RETURN(0);
00086 }

00088 static int mgs_exception(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00089 {
00090         ENTRY;
00091 
00092         tgt_counter_incr(tsi->tsi_exp, LPROC_MGS_EXCEPTION);
00093 
00094         RETURN(0);
00095 }

00097 static inline bool str_starts_with(const char *str, const char *prefix)
00098 {
00099         return strncmp(str, prefix, strlen(prefix)) == 0;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static int mgs_set_info(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00103 {
00104         struct mgs_thread_info  *mgi;
00105         struct mgs_send_param   *msp, *rep_msp;
00106         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
00107         size_t                   param_len;
00108         char                    *s;
00109         int                      rc;
00110 
00111         ENTRY;
00112 
00113         mgi = mgs_env_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00114         if (IS_ERR(mgi))
00115                 RETURN(err_serious(PTR_ERR(mgi)));
00116 
00117         msp = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MGS_SEND_PARAM);
00118         if (msp == NULL)
00119                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
00120 
00121         param_len = strnlen(msp->mgs_param, sizeof(msp->mgs_param));
00122         if (param_len == 0 || param_len == sizeof(msp->mgs_param))
00123                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00124 
00125         /* We only allow '*.lov.stripe{size,count,offset}=*' from an RPC. */
00126         s = strchr(msp->mgs_param, '.');
00127         if (s == NULL)
00128                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00129 
00130         if (!str_starts_with(s + 1, "lov.stripesize=") &&
00131             !str_starts_with(s + 1, "lov.stripecount=") &&
00132             !str_starts_with(s + 1, "lov.stripeoffset="))
00133                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00134 
00135         /* Construct lustre_cfg structure to pass to function mgs_setparam */
00136         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&mgi->mgi_bufs, NULL);
00137         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&mgi->mgi_bufs, 1, msp->mgs_param);
00138         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_PARAM, &mgi->mgi_bufs);
00139         if (lcfg == NULL)
00140                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00141 
00142         rc = mgs_setparam(tsi->tsi_env, exp2mgs_dev(tsi->tsi_exp), lcfg,
00143                           mgi->mgi_fsname);
00144         if (rc) {
00145                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Unable to set parameter %s for %s: %d\n",
00146                               tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), msp->mgs_param,
00147                               mgi->mgi_fsname, rc);
00148                 GOTO(out_cfg, rc);
00149         }
00150 
00151         /* send back the whole msp in the reply */
00152         rep_msp = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MGS_SEND_PARAM);
00153         *rep_msp = *msp;
00154         EXIT;
00155 out_cfg:
00156         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00157         return rc;
00158 }
00159 
00160 enum ast_type {
00161                 AST_CONFIG = 1,
00162                 AST_PARAMS = 2,
00163                 AST_IR = 3
00164 };
00165 
00166 static int mgs_completion_ast_generic(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags,
00167                                      void *cbdata, enum ast_type type)
00168 {
00169         ENTRY;
00170 
00171         if (!(flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK)) {
00172                 struct fs_db *fsdb;
00173 
00174                 /* l_ast_data is used as a marker to avoid cancel ldlm lock
00175                  * twice. See LU-2317. */
00176                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00177                 fsdb = (struct fs_db *)lock->l_ast_data;
00178                 lock->l_ast_data = NULL;
00179                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00180 
00181                 if (fsdb != NULL) {
00182                         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00183 
00184                         switch(type) {
00185                                 case AST_CONFIG:
00186                                         /* clear the bit before lock put */
00187                                         clear_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_LOCK,
00188                                                   &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00189                                         break;
00190                                 case AST_PARAMS:
00191                                         clear_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_PARAMS,
00192                                                   &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00193                                         break;
00194                                 case AST_IR:
00195                                         mgs_ir_notify_complete(fsdb);
00196                                         break;
00197                                 default:
00198                                         LBUG();
00199                         }
00200 
00201                         ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00202                         ldlm_lock_decref_and_cancel(&lockh, LCK_EX);
00203                 }
00204         }
00205 
00206         RETURN(ldlm_completion_ast(lock, flags, cbdata));
00207 }
00208 
00209 static int mgs_completion_ast_config(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags,
00210                                      void *cbdata)
00211 {
00212         return mgs_completion_ast_generic(lock, flags, cbdata, AST_CONFIG);
00213 }
00214 
00215 static int mgs_completion_ast_params(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags,
00216                                      void *cbdata)
00217 {
00218         return mgs_completion_ast_generic(lock, flags, cbdata, AST_PARAMS);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static int mgs_completion_ast_ir(struct ldlm_lock *lock, __u64 flags,
00222                                  void *cbdata)
00223 {
00224         return mgs_completion_ast_generic(lock, flags, cbdata, AST_IR);
00225 }
00226 
00227 void mgs_revoke_lock(struct mgs_device *mgs, struct fs_db *fsdb, int type)
00228 {
00229         ldlm_completion_callback cp = NULL;
00230         struct lustre_handle     lockh = { 0 };
00231         struct ldlm_res_id       res_id;
00232         __u64 flags = LDLM_FL_ATOMIC_CB;
00233         int rc;
00234         ENTRY;
00235 
00236         LASSERT(fsdb->fsdb_name[0] != '\0');
00237         rc = mgc_fsname2resid(fsdb->fsdb_name, &res_id, type);
00238         LASSERT(rc == 0);
00239         switch (type) {
00240         case CONFIG_T_CONFIG:
00241                 cp = mgs_completion_ast_config;
00242                 if (test_and_set_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_LOCK, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
00243                         rc = -EALREADY;
00244                 break;
00245         case CONFIG_T_PARAMS:
00246                 cp = mgs_completion_ast_params;
00247                 if (test_and_set_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_PARAMS, &fsdb->fsdb_flags))
00248                         rc = -EALREADY;
00249                 break;
00250         case CONFIG_T_RECOVER:
00251                 cp = mgs_completion_ast_ir;
00252         default:
00253                 break;
00254         }
00255 
00256         if (!rc) {
00257                 LASSERT(cp != NULL);
00258                 rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_local(mgs->mgs_obd->obd_namespace,
00259                                             &res_id, LDLM_PLAIN, NULL, LCK_EX,
00260                                             &flags, ldlm_blocking_ast, cp,
00261                                             NULL, fsdb, 0, LVB_T_NONE, NULL,
00262                                             &lockh);
00263                 if (rc != ELDLM_OK) {
00264                         CERROR("can't take cfg lock for "LPX64"/"LPX64"(%d)\n",
00265                                le64_to_cpu(res_id.name[0]),
00266                                le64_to_cpu(res_id.name[1]), rc);
00267 
00268                         if (type == CONFIG_T_CONFIG)
00269                                 clear_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_LOCK,
00270                                           &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00271 
00272                         if (type == CONFIG_T_PARAMS)
00273                                 clear_bit(FSDB_REVOKING_PARAMS,
00274                                           &fsdb->fsdb_flags);
00275                 }
00276                 /* lock has been cancelled in completion_ast. */
00277         }
00278 
00279         RETURN_EXIT;
00280 }
00281 
00282 /* rc=0 means ok
00283       1 means update
00284      <0 means error */
00285 static int mgs_check_target(const struct lu_env *env,
00286                             struct mgs_device *mgs,
00287                             struct mgs_target_info *mti)
00288 {
00289         int rc;
00290         ENTRY;
00291 
00292         rc = mgs_check_index(env, mgs, mti);
00293         if (rc == 0) {
00294                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x13b, "%s claims to have registered, but "
00295                                    "this MGS does not know about it, preventing "
00296                                    "registration.\n", mti->mti_svname);
00297                 rc = -ENOENT;
00298         } else if (rc == -1) {
00299                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x13c, "Client log %s-client has "
00300                                    "disappeared! Regenerating all logs.\n",
00301                                    mti->mti_fsname);
00302                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_WRITECONF;
00303                 rc = 1;
00304         } else {
00305                 /* Index is correctly marked as used */
00306 
00307                 /* If the logs don't contain the mti_nids then add
00308                    them as failover nids */
00309                 rc = mgs_check_failnid(env, mgs, mti);
00310         }
00311 
00312         RETURN(rc);
00313 }
00314 
00315 /* Ensure this is not a failover node that is connecting first*/
00316 static int mgs_check_failover_reg(struct mgs_target_info *mti)
00317 {
00318         lnet_nid_t nid;
00319         char *ptr;
00320         int i;
00321 
00322         ptr = mti->mti_params;
00323         while (class_find_param(ptr, PARAM_FAILNODE, &ptr) == 0) {
00324                 while (class_parse_nid_quiet(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
00325                         for (i = 0; i < mti->mti_nid_count; i++) {
00326                                 if (nid == mti->mti_nids[i]) {
00327                                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Denying initial registra"
00328                                                       "tion attempt from nid %s"
00329                                                       ", specified as failover"
00330                                                       "\n",libcfs_nid2str(nid));
00331                                         return -EADDRNOTAVAIL;
00332                                 }
00333                         }
00334                 }
00335         }
00336         return 0;
00337 }
00338 
00339 /* Called whenever a target starts up.  Flags indicate first connect, etc. */
00340 static int mgs_target_reg(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00341 {
00342         struct obd_device       *obd = tsi->tsi_exp->exp_obd;
00343         struct mgs_device       *mgs = exp2mgs_dev(tsi->tsi_exp);
00344         struct mgs_target_info  *mti, *rep_mti;
00345         struct fs_db            *fsdb;
00346         int                      opc;
00347         int                      rc = 0;
00348 
00349         ENTRY;
00350 
00351         rc = lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)tsi->tsi_env);
00352         if (rc)
00353                 return err_serious(rc);
00354 
00355         tgt_counter_incr(tsi->tsi_exp, LPROC_MGS_TARGET_REG);
00356 
00357         mti = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MGS_TARGET_INFO);
00358         if (mti == NULL) {
00359                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, tgt_ses_req(tsi), "no mgs_send_param");
00360                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
00361         }
00362 
00363         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&tgt_ses_req(tsi)->rq_export->exp_connect_data,
00364                          IMP_RECOV))
00365                 opc = mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_OPC_MASK;
00366         else
00367                 opc = LDD_F_OPC_REG;
00368 
00369         if (opc == LDD_F_OPC_READY) {
00370                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "fs: %s index: %d is ready to reconnect.\n",
00371                        mti->mti_fsname, mti->mti_stripe_index);
00372                 rc = mgs_ir_update(tsi->tsi_env, mgs, mti);
00373                 if (rc) {
00374                         LASSERT(!(mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_IR_CAPABLE));
00375                         CERROR("Update IR return with %d(ignore and IR "
00376                                "disabled)\n", rc);
00377                 }
00378                 GOTO(out_nolock, rc);
00379         }
00380 
00381         /* Do not support unregistering right now. */
00382         if (opc != LDD_F_OPC_REG)
00383                 GOTO(out_nolock, rc = -EINVAL);
00384 
00385         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "fs: %s index: %d is registered to MGS.\n",
00386                mti->mti_fsname, mti->mti_stripe_index);
00387 
00388         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_NEED_INDEX)
00389                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_WRITECONF;
00390 
00391         if (!(mti->mti_flags & (LDD_F_WRITECONF | LDD_F_UPGRADE14 |
00392                                 LDD_F_UPDATE))) {
00393                 /* We're just here as a startup ping. */
00394                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "Server %s is running on %s\n",
00395                        mti->mti_svname, obd_export_nid2str(tsi->tsi_exp));
00396                 rc = mgs_check_target(tsi->tsi_env, mgs, mti);
00397                 /* above will set appropriate mti flags */
00398                 if (rc <= 0)
00399                         /* Nothing wrong, or fatal error */
00400                         GOTO(out_nolock, rc);
00401         } else if (!(mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_NO_PRIMNODE)) {
00402                 rc = mgs_check_failover_reg(mti);
00403                 if (rc)
00404                         GOTO(out_nolock, rc);
00405         }
00406 
00407         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_MGS_PAUSE_TARGET_REG, 10);
00408 
00409         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_WRITECONF) {
00410                 if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT &&
00411                     mti->mti_stripe_index == 0) {
00412                         rc = mgs_erase_logs(tsi->tsi_env, mgs,
00413                                             mti->mti_fsname);
00414                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Logs for fs %s were removed by user "
00415                                       "request.  All servers must be restarted "
00416                                       "in order to regenerate the logs."
00417                                       "\n", obd->obd_name, mti->mti_fsname);
00418                 } else if (mti->mti_flags &
00419                            (LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST | LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT)) {
00420                         rc = mgs_erase_log(tsi->tsi_env, mgs, mti->mti_svname);
00421                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Regenerating %s log by user "
00422                                       "request.\n",
00423                                       obd->obd_name, mti->mti_svname);
00424                 }
00425                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_UPDATE;
00426                 /* Erased logs means start from scratch. */
00427                 mti->mti_flags &= ~LDD_F_UPGRADE14;
00428                 if (rc)
00429                         GOTO(out_nolock, rc);
00430         }
00431 
00432         rc = mgs_find_or_make_fsdb(tsi->tsi_env, mgs, mti->mti_fsname, &fsdb);
00433         if (rc) {
00434                 CERROR("Can't get db for %s: %d\n", mti->mti_fsname, rc);
00435                 GOTO(out_nolock, rc);
00436         }
00437 
00438         /*
00439          * Log writing contention is handled by the fsdb_mutex.
00440          *
00441          * It should be alright if someone was reading while we were
00442          * updating the logs - if we revoke at the end they will just update
00443          * from where they left off.
00444          */
00445 
00446         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_UPGRADE14) {
00447                 CERROR("Can't upgrade from 1.4 (%d)\n", rc);
00448                 GOTO(out, rc);
00449         }
00450 
00451         if (mti->mti_flags & LDD_F_UPDATE) {
00452                 CDEBUG(D_MGS, "updating %s, index=%d\n", mti->mti_svname,
00453                        mti->mti_stripe_index);
00454 
00455                 /* create or update the target log
00456                    and update the client/mdt logs */
00457                 rc = mgs_write_log_target(tsi->tsi_env, mgs, mti, fsdb);
00458                 if (rc) {
00459                         CERROR("Failed to write %s log (%d)\n",
00460                                mti->mti_svname, rc);
00461                         GOTO(out, rc);
00462                 }
00463 
00464                 mti->mti_flags &= ~(LDD_F_VIRGIN | LDD_F_UPDATE |
00465                                     LDD_F_NEED_INDEX | LDD_F_WRITECONF |
00466                                     LDD_F_UPGRADE14);
00467                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_REWRITE_LDD;
00468         }
00469 
00470 out:
00471         mgs_revoke_lock(mgs, fsdb, CONFIG_T_CONFIG);
00472 
00473 out_nolock:
00474         CDEBUG(D_MGS, "replying with %s, index=%d, rc=%d\n", mti->mti_svname,
00475                mti->mti_stripe_index, rc);
00476          /* An error flag is set in the mti reply rather than an error code */
00477         if (rc)
00478                 mti->mti_flags |= LDD_F_ERROR;
00479 
00480         /* send back the whole mti in the reply */
00481         rep_mti = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MGS_TARGET_INFO);
00482         *rep_mti = *mti;
00483 
00484         /* Flush logs to disk */
00485         dt_sync(tsi->tsi_env, mgs->mgs_bottom);
00486         RETURN(rc);
00487 }
00488 
00489 /* Called whenever a target cleans up. */
00490 static int mgs_target_del(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00491 {
00492         ENTRY;
00493 
00494         tgt_counter_incr(tsi->tsi_exp, LPROC_MGS_TARGET_DEL);
00495 
00496         RETURN(0);
00497 }
00498 
00499 static int mgs_config_read(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00500 {
00501         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
00502         struct mgs_config_body  *body;
00503         int                      rc;
00504 
00505         ENTRY;
00506 
00507         body = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_MGS_CONFIG_BODY);
00508         if (body == NULL) {
00509                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "no mgs_config_body");
00510                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
00511         }
00512 
00513         switch (body->mcb_type) {
00514         case CONFIG_T_RECOVER:
00515                 rc = mgs_get_ir_logs(req);
00516                 break;
00517         case CONFIG_T_CONFIG:
00518                 rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00519                 break;
00520         default:
00521                 rc = -EINVAL;
00522                 break;
00523         }
00524 
00525         RETURN(rc);
00526 }
00527 
00528 static int mgs_llog_open(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00529 {
00530         struct mgs_thread_info  *mgi;
00531         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
00532         char                    *logname;
00533         int                      rc;
00534 
00535         ENTRY;
00536 
00537         rc = tgt_llog_open(tsi);
00538         if (rc)
00539                 RETURN(rc);
00540 
00541         /*
00542          * For old clients there is no direct way of knowing which file system
00543          * a client is operating at the MGS side. But we need to pick up those
00544          * clients so that the MGS can mark the corresponding file system as
00545          * non-IR capable because old clients are not ready to be notified.
00546          *
00547          * Therefore we attempt to detect the file systems name by hacking the
00548          * llog operation which is currently used by the clients to fetch
00549          * configuration logs. At present this is fine because this is the
00550          * ONLY llog operation between mgc and the MGS.
00551          *
00552          * If extra llog operation are going to be added, this function needs
00553          * further work.
00554          *
00555          * When releases prior than 2.0 are not supported, the following code
00556          * can be removed.
00557          */
00558         mgi = mgs_env_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00559         if (IS_ERR(mgi))
00560                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(mgi));
00561 
00562         logname = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_NAME);
00563         if (logname) {
00564                 char *ptr = strchr(logname, '-');
00565                 int   len = (ptr != NULL) ? (int)(ptr - logname) : 0;
00566 
00567                 if (ptr == NULL || len >= sizeof(mgi->mgi_fsname)) {
00568                         if (strcmp(logname, PARAMS_FILENAME) != 0)
00569                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: non-config logname "
00570                                               "received: %s\n",
00571                                               tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
00572                                               logname);
00573                         /* not error, this can be llog test name */
00574                 } else {
00575                         strncpy(mgi->mgi_fsname, logname, len);
00576                         mgi->mgi_fsname[len] = 0;
00577 
00578                         rc = mgs_fsc_attach(tsi->tsi_env, tsi->tsi_exp,
00579                                             mgi->mgi_fsname);
00580                         if (rc && rc != -EEXIST) {
00581                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Unable to add client %s "
00582                                               "to file system %s: %d\n",
00583                                               tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
00584                                               libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
00585                                               mgi->mgi_fsname, rc);
00586                         } else {
00587                                 rc = 0;
00588                         }
00589                 }
00590         } else {
00591                 CERROR("%s: no logname in request\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
00592                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00593         }
00594         RETURN(rc);
00595 }
00596 
00597 static inline int mgs_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00598 {
00599         struct mgs_export_data *data = &exp->u.eu_mgs_data;
00600 
00601         /* init mgs_export_data for fsc */
00602         spin_lock_init(&data->med_lock);
00603         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&data->med_clients);
00604 
00605         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
00606         exp->exp_connecting = 1;
00607         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
00608 
00609         /* self-export doesn't need client data and ldlm initialization */
00610         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
00611                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
00612                 return 0;
00613         return ldlm_init_export(exp);
00614 }
00615 
00616 static inline int mgs_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00617 {
00618         ENTRY;
00619 
00620         target_destroy_export(exp);
00621         mgs_client_free(exp);
00622 
00623         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
00624                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
00625                 RETURN(0);
00626 
00627         ldlm_destroy_export(exp);
00628 
00629         RETURN(0);
00630 }
00631 
00632 static int mgs_extract_fs_pool(char * arg, char *fsname, char *poolname)
00633 {
00634         char *ptr;
00635 
00636         ENTRY;
00637         for (ptr = arg;  (*ptr != '\0') && (*ptr != '.'); ptr++ ) {
00638                 *fsname = *ptr;
00639                 fsname++;
00640         }
00641         if (*ptr == '\0')
00642                 return -EINVAL;
00643         *fsname = '\0';
00644         ptr++;
00645         strcpy(poolname, ptr);
00646 
00647         RETURN(0);
00648 }
00649 
00650 static int mgs_iocontrol_nodemap(const struct lu_env *env,
00651                                  struct mgs_device *mgs,
00652                                  struct obd_ioctl_data *data)
00653 {
00654         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg = NULL;
00655         lnet_nid_t              nid;
00656         const char              *nodemap_name = NULL;
00657         const char              *nidstr = NULL;
00658         const char              *client_idstr = NULL;
00659         const char              *idtype_str = NULL;
00660         char                    *param = NULL;
00661         char                    fs_idstr[16];
00662         char                    name_buf[LUSTRE_NODEMAP_NAME_LENGTH + 1];
00663         int                     rc = 0;
00664         unsigned long           client_id;
00665         __u32                   fs_id;
00666         __u32                   cmd;
00667         int                     idtype;
00668 
00669         ENTRY;
00670 
00671         if (data->ioc_type != LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE) {
00672                 CERROR("%s: unknown cfg record type: %d\n",
00673                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, data->ioc_type);
00674                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00675         }
00676 
00677         if (data->ioc_plen1 > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)
00678                 GOTO(out, rc = -E2BIG);
00679 
00680         OBD_ALLOC(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00681         if (lcfg == NULL)
00682                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00683 
00684         if (copy_from_user(lcfg, data->ioc_pbuf1, data->ioc_plen1))
00685                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EFAULT);
00686 
00687         cmd = lcfg->lcfg_command;
00688 
00689         switch (cmd) {
00690         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ACTIVATE:
00691                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 2)
00692                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00693                 param = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00694                 if (strcmp(param, "1") == 0)
00695                                 nodemap_activate(1);
00696                 else
00697                                 nodemap_activate(0);
00698                 break;
00699         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD:
00700         case LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL:
00701                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 2)
00702                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00703                 nodemap_name = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00704                 rc = mgs_nodemap_cmd(env, mgs, cmd, nodemap_name, param);
00705                 break;
00706         case LCFG_NODEMAP_TEST_NID:
00707                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 2)
00708                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00709                 nidstr = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00710                 nid = libcfs_str2nid(nidstr);
00711                 nodemap_test_nid(nid, name_buf, sizeof(name_buf));
00712                 rc = copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf1, name_buf,
00713                                   MIN(data->ioc_plen1, sizeof(name_buf)));
00714                 if (rc != 0)
00715                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EFAULT);
00716                 break;
00717         case LCFG_NODEMAP_TEST_ID:
00718                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 4)
00719                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00720                 nidstr = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00721                 idtype_str = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
00722                 client_idstr = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3);
00723 
00724                 nid = libcfs_str2nid(nidstr);
00725                 if (strcmp(idtype_str, "uid") == 0)
00726                         idtype = NODEMAP_UID;
00727                 else
00728                         idtype = NODEMAP_GID;
00729 
00730                 rc = kstrtoul(client_idstr, 10, &client_id);
00731                 if (rc != 0)
00732                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00733 
00734                 fs_id = nodemap_test_id(nid, idtype, client_id);
00735 
00736                 if (data->ioc_plen1 < sizeof(fs_idstr))
00737                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00738 
00739                 snprintf(fs_idstr, sizeof(fs_idstr), "%u", fs_id);
00740                 if (copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf1, fs_idstr,
00741                                  sizeof(fs_idstr)) != 0)
00742                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00743                 break;
00744         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_RANGE:
00745         case LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_RANGE:
00746         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_UIDMAP:
00747         case LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_UIDMAP:
00748         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ADD_GIDMAP:
00749         case LCFG_NODEMAP_DEL_GIDMAP:
00750                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 3)
00751                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00752                 nodemap_name = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00753                 param = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2);
00754                 rc = mgs_nodemap_cmd(env, mgs, cmd, nodemap_name, param);
00755                 break;
00756         case LCFG_NODEMAP_ADMIN:
00757         case LCFG_NODEMAP_TRUSTED:
00758         case LCFG_NODEMAP_SQUASH_UID:
00759         case LCFG_NODEMAP_SQUASH_GID:
00760                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 4)
00761                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00762                 nodemap_name = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1);
00763                 param = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3);
00764                 rc = mgs_nodemap_cmd(env, mgs, cmd, nodemap_name, param);
00765                 break;
00766         default:
00767                 rc = -ENOTTY;
00768         }
00769 
00770         if (rc != 0) {
00771                 CERROR("%s: OBD_IOC_NODEMAP command %X for %s: rc = %d\n",
00772                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, lcfg->lcfg_command,
00773                        nodemap_name, rc);
00774                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc);
00775         }
00776 
00777 out_lcfg:
00778         OBD_FREE(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00779 out:
00780         RETURN(rc);
00781 }
00782 
00783 static int mgs_iocontrol_pool(const struct lu_env *env,
00784                               struct mgs_device *mgs,
00785                               struct obd_ioctl_data *data)
00786 {
00787         struct mgs_thread_info *mgi = mgs_env_info(env);
00788         int rc;
00789         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg = NULL;
00790         char *poolname = NULL;
00791         ENTRY;
00792 
00793         OBD_ALLOC(poolname, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME + 1);
00794         if (poolname == NULL)
00795                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00796 
00797         if (data->ioc_type != LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE) {
00798                 CERROR("%s: unknown cfg record type: %d\n",
00799                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, data->ioc_type);
00800                 GOTO(out_pool, rc = -EINVAL);
00801         }
00802 
00803         if (data->ioc_plen1 > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)
00804                 GOTO(out_pool, rc = -E2BIG);
00805 
00806         OBD_ALLOC(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00807         if (lcfg == NULL)
00808                 GOTO(out_pool, rc = -ENOMEM);
00809 
00810         if (copy_from_user(lcfg, data->ioc_pbuf1, data->ioc_plen1))
00811                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EFAULT);
00812 
00813         if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount < 2)
00814                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EFAULT);
00815 
00816         /* first arg is always <fsname>.<poolname> */
00817         rc = mgs_extract_fs_pool(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 1), mgi->mgi_fsname,
00818                                  poolname);
00819         if (rc)
00820                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc);
00821 
00822         switch (lcfg->lcfg_command) {
00823         case LCFG_POOL_NEW:
00824                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 2)
00825                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00826                 rc = mgs_pool_cmd(env, mgs, LCFG_POOL_NEW, mgi->mgi_fsname,
00827                                   poolname, NULL);
00828                 break;
00829         case LCFG_POOL_ADD:
00830                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 3)
00831                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00832                 rc = mgs_pool_cmd(env, mgs, LCFG_POOL_ADD, mgi->mgi_fsname,
00833                                   poolname, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
00834                 break;
00835         case LCFG_POOL_REM:
00836                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 3)
00837                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00838                 rc = mgs_pool_cmd(env, mgs, LCFG_POOL_REM, mgi->mgi_fsname,
00839                                   poolname, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
00840                 break;
00841         case LCFG_POOL_DEL:
00842                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount != 2)
00843                         GOTO(out_lcfg, rc = -EINVAL);
00844                 rc = mgs_pool_cmd(env, mgs, LCFG_POOL_DEL, mgi->mgi_fsname,
00845                                   poolname, NULL);
00846                 break;
00847         default:
00848                  rc = -EINVAL;
00849         }
00850 
00851         if (rc) {
00852                 CERROR("OBD_IOC_POOL err %d, cmd %X for pool %s.%s\n",
00853                        rc, lcfg->lcfg_command, mgi->mgi_fsname, poolname);
00854                 GOTO(out_lcfg, rc);
00855         }
00856 
00857 out_lcfg:
00858         OBD_FREE(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00859 out_pool:
00860         OBD_FREE(poolname, LOV_MAXPOOLNAME + 1);
00861         RETURN(rc);
00862 }
00863 
00864 /* from mdt_iocontrol */
00865 static int mgs_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
00866                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
00867 {
00868         struct mgs_device *mgs = exp2mgs_dev(exp);
00869         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
00870         struct lu_env env;
00871         int rc = 0;
00872 
00873         ENTRY;
00874         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "handling ioctl cmd %#x\n", cmd);
00875 
00876         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_MG_THREAD);
00877         if (rc)
00878                 RETURN(rc);
00879 
00880         switch (cmd) {
00881 
00882         case OBD_IOC_PARAM: {
00883                 struct mgs_thread_info *mgi = mgs_env_info(&env);
00884                 struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00885 
00886                 if (data->ioc_type != LUSTRE_CFG_TYPE) {
00887                         CERROR("%s: unknown cfg record type: %d\n",
00888                                mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name, data->ioc_type);
00889                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00890                 }
00891 
00892                 OBD_ALLOC(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00893                 if (lcfg == NULL)
00894                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00895                 if (copy_from_user(lcfg, data->ioc_pbuf1, data->ioc_plen1))
00896                         GOTO(out_free, rc = -EFAULT);
00897 
00898                 if (lcfg->lcfg_bufcount < 1)
00899                         GOTO(out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
00900 
00901                 rc = mgs_setparam(&env, mgs, lcfg, mgi->mgi_fsname);
00902                 if (rc)
00903                         CERROR("%s: setparam err: rc = %d\n",
00904                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
00905 out_free:
00906                 OBD_FREE(lcfg, data->ioc_plen1);
00907                 break;
00908         }
00909 
00910         case OBD_IOC_REPLACE_NIDS: {
00911                 if (!data->ioc_inllen1 || !data->ioc_inlbuf1) {
00912                         CERROR("No device name specified!\n");
00913                         rc = -EINVAL;
00914                         break;
00915                 }
00916 
00917                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1[data->ioc_inllen1 - 1] != 0) {
00918                         CERROR("Device name is not NUL terminated!\n");
00919                         rc = -EINVAL;
00920                         break;
00921                 }
00922 
00923                 if (data->ioc_plen1 > MTI_NAME_MAXLEN) {
00924                         CERROR("Device name is too long\n");
00925                         rc = -EOVERFLOW;
00926                         break;
00927                 }
00928 
00929                 if (!data->ioc_inllen2 || !data->ioc_inlbuf2) {
00930                         CERROR("No NIDs were specified!\n");
00931                         rc = -EINVAL;
00932                         break;
00933                 }
00934 
00935                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf2[data->ioc_inllen2 - 1] != 0) {
00936                         CERROR("NID list is not NUL terminated!\n");
00937                         rc = -EINVAL;
00938                         break;
00939                 }
00940 
00941                 /* replace nids in llog */
00942                 rc = mgs_replace_nids(&env, mgs, data->ioc_inlbuf1,
00943                                       data->ioc_inlbuf2);
00944                 if (rc)
00945                         CERROR("%s: error replacing nids: rc = %d\n",
00946                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
00947 
00948                 break;
00949         }
00950 
00951         case OBD_IOC_POOL:
00952                 rc = mgs_iocontrol_pool(&env, mgs, data);
00953                 break;
00954 
00955         case OBD_IOC_NODEMAP:
00956                 rc = mgs_iocontrol_nodemap(&env, mgs, data);
00957                 break;
00958 
00959         case OBD_IOC_CATLOGLIST:
00960                 rc = mgs_list_logs(&env, mgs, data);
00961                 break;
00962         case OBD_IOC_LLOG_CANCEL:
00963         case OBD_IOC_LLOG_REMOVE:
00964         case OBD_IOC_LLOG_CHECK:
00965         case OBD_IOC_LLOG_INFO:
00966         case OBD_IOC_LLOG_PRINT: {
00967                 struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
00968 
00969                 ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
00970                 rc = llog_ioctl(&env, ctxt, cmd, data);
00971                 llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00972                 break;
00973         }
00974 
00975         default:
00976                 CERROR("%s: unknown command %#x\n",
00977                        mgs->mgs_obd->obd_name,  cmd);
00978                 rc = -ENOTTY;
00979                 break;
00980         }
00981 out:
00982         lu_env_fini(&env);
00983         RETURN(rc);
00984 }
00985 
00986 static int mgs_connect_to_osd(struct mgs_device *m, const char *nextdev)
00987 {
00988         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00989         struct obd_device       *obd;
00990         int                      rc;
00991         ENTRY;
00992 
00993         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00994         if (data == NULL)
00995                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00996 
00997         obd = class_name2obd(nextdev);
00998         if (obd == NULL) {
00999                 CERROR("can't locate next device: %s\n", nextdev);
01000                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
01001         }
01002 
01003         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01004 
01005         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &m->mgs_bottom_exp, obd,
01006                          &obd->obd_uuid, data, NULL);
01007         if (rc) {
01008                 CERROR("cannot connect to next dev %s (%d)\n", nextdev, rc);
01009                 GOTO(out, rc);
01010         }
01011 
01012         m->mgs_bottom = lu2dt_dev(m->mgs_bottom_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
01013         m->mgs_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site = m->mgs_bottom->dd_lu_dev.ld_site;
01014         LASSERT(m->mgs_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site);
01015 out:
01016         OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
01017         RETURN(rc);
01018 }
01019 
01020 static struct tgt_handler mgs_mgs_handlers[] = {
01021 TGT_RPC_HANDLER(MGS_FIRST_OPC,
01022                 0,                      MGS_CONNECT,     mgs_connect,
01023                 &RQF_CONNECT, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION),
01024 TGT_RPC_HANDLER(MGS_FIRST_OPC,
01025                 0,                      MGS_DISCONNECT,  mgs_disconnect,
01026                 &RQF_MDS_DISCONNECT, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION),
01027 TGT_MGS_HDL_VAR(0,                      MGS_EXCEPTION,   mgs_exception),
01028 TGT_MGS_HDL    (HABEO_REFERO | MUTABOR, MGS_SET_INFO,    mgs_set_info),
01029 TGT_MGS_HDL    (HABEO_REFERO | MUTABOR, MGS_TARGET_REG,  mgs_target_reg),
01030 TGT_MGS_HDL_VAR(0,                      MGS_TARGET_DEL,  mgs_target_del),
01031 TGT_MGS_HDL    (HABEO_REFERO,           MGS_CONFIG_READ, mgs_config_read),
01032 };

01034 static struct tgt_handler mgs_obd_handlers[] = {
01035 TGT_OBD_HDL(0,  OBD_PING,       tgt_obd_ping),
01036 };
01037 
01038 static struct tgt_handler mgs_dlm_handlers[] = {
01039 [LDLM_ENQUEUE - LDLM_FIRST_OPC] = {
01040         .th_name = "LDLM_ENQUEUE",
01041         /* don't use th_fail_id for MGS to don't interfere with MDS tests.
01042          * * There are no tests for MGS with OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_NET so it
01043          * * is safe. If such tests will be needed we have to distinguish
01044          * * MDS and MGS fail ids, e.g use OBD_FAIL_MGS_ENQUEUE_NET for MGS
01045          * * instead of common OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_NET */
01046         .th_fail_id = 0,
01047         .th_opc = LDLM_ENQUEUE,
01048         .th_flags = HABEO_CLAVIS,
01049         .th_act = tgt_enqueue,
01050         .th_fmt = &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE,
01051         .th_version = LUSTRE_DLM_VERSION,
01052         },
01053 };

01056 TGT_LLOG_HDL    (0,     LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_CREATE,      mgs_llog_open),
01057 TGT_LLOG_HDL    (0,     LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_NEXT_BLOCK,  tgt_llog_next_block),
01058 TGT_LLOG_HDL    (0,     LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_READ_HEADER, tgt_llog_read_header),
01059 TGT_LLOG_HDL_VAR(0,     LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_CLOSE,       tgt_llog_close),
01060 TGT_LLOG_HDL    (0,     LLOG_ORIGIN_HANDLE_PREV_BLOCK,  tgt_llog_prev_block),
01061 };

01088         },

01091         }

01093 
01094 static int mgs_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct mgs_device *mgs,
01095                      struct lu_device_type *ldt, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01096 {
01097         struct ptlrpc_service_conf       conf;
01098         struct obd_device               *obd;
01099         struct lustre_mount_info        *lmi;
01100         struct llog_ctxt                *ctxt;
01101         struct fs_db                    *fsdb = NULL;
01102         struct fs_db                    *fsdb_srpc = NULL;
01103         int                              rc;
01104 
01105         ENTRY;
01106 
01107         lmi = server_get_mount(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01108         if (lmi == NULL)
01109                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
01110 
01111         mgs->mgs_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_ops = &mgs_lu_ops;
01112 
01113         rc = mgs_connect_to_osd(mgs, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01114         if (rc)
01115                 GOTO(err_lmi, rc);
01116 
01117         obd = class_name2obd(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0));
01118         LASSERT(obd);
01119         mgs->mgs_obd = obd;
01120         mgs->mgs_obd->obd_lu_dev = &mgs->mgs_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
01121 
01122         obd->u.obt.obt_magic = OBT_MAGIC;
01123         obd->u.obt.obt_instance = 0;
01124 
01125         /* namespace for mgs llog */
01126         obd->obd_namespace = ldlm_namespace_new(obd ,"MGS",
01127                                                 LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER,
01128                                                 LDLM_NAMESPACE_MODEST,
01129                                                 LDLM_NS_TYPE_MGT);
01130         if (obd->obd_namespace == NULL)
01131                 GOTO(err_ops, rc = -ENOMEM);
01132 
01133         /* No recovery for MGCs */
01134         obd->obd_replayable = 0;
01135 
01136         rc = tgt_init(env, &mgs->mgs_lut, obd, mgs->mgs_bottom,
01137                       mgs_common_slice, OBD_FAIL_MGS_ALL_REQUEST_NET,
01138                       OBD_FAIL_MGS_ALL_REPLY_NET);
01139         if (rc)
01140                 GOTO(err_ns, rc);
01141 
01142         rc = mgs_fs_setup(env, mgs);
01143         if (rc) {
01144                 CERROR("%s: MGS filesystem method init failed: rc = %d\n",
01145                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01146                 GOTO(err_tgt, rc);
01147         }
01148 
01149         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT,
01150                         obd, &llog_osd_ops);
01151         if (rc)
01152                 GOTO(err_fs, rc);
01153 
01154         /* XXX: we need this trick till N:1 stack is supported
01155          * set "current" directory for named llogs */
01156         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01157         LASSERT(ctxt);
01158         ctxt->loc_dir = mgs->mgs_configs_dir;
01159         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01160 
01161         /* Internal mgs setup */
01162         mgs_init_fsdb_list(mgs);
01163         mutex_init(&mgs->mgs_mutex);
01164         mgs->mgs_start_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
01165         spin_lock_init(&mgs->mgs_lock);
01166         mutex_init(&mgs->mgs_health_mutex);
01167 
01168         rc = lproc_mgs_setup(mgs, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
01169         if (rc != 0) {
01170                 CERROR("%s: cannot initialize proc entry: rc = %d\n",
01171                        obd->obd_name, rc);
01172                 GOTO(err_llog, rc);
01173         }
01174 
01175         /* Setup params fsdb and log, so that other servers can make a local
01176          * copy successfully when they are mounted. See LU-4783 */
01177         rc = mgs_params_fsdb_setup(env, mgs, fsdb);
01178         if (rc)
01179                 /* params fsdb and log can be setup later */
01180                 CERROR("%s: %s fsdb and log setup failed: rc = %d\n",
01181                        obd->obd_name, PARAMS_FILENAME, rc);
01182 
01183         /* Setup _mgs fsdb, useful for srpc */
01184         mgs__mgs_fsdb_setup(env, mgs, fsdb_srpc);
01185 
01186         ptlrpc_init_client(LDLM_CB_REQUEST_PORTAL, LDLM_CB_REPLY_PORTAL,
01187                            "mgs_ldlm_client", &obd->obd_ldlm_client);
01188 
01189         conf = (typeof(conf)) {
01190                 .psc_name               = LUSTRE_MGS_NAME,
01191                 .psc_watchdog_factor    = MGS_SERVICE_WATCHDOG_FACTOR,
01192                 .psc_buf                = {
01193                         .bc_nbufs               = MGS_NBUFS,
01194                         .bc_buf_size            = MGS_BUFSIZE,
01195                         .bc_req_max_size        = MGS_MAXREQSIZE,
01196                         .bc_rep_max_size        = MGS_MAXREPSIZE,
01197                         .bc_req_portal          = MGS_REQUEST_PORTAL,
01198                         .bc_rep_portal          = MGC_REPLY_PORTAL,
01199                 },
01200                 .psc_thr                = {
01201                         .tc_thr_name            = "ll_mgs",
01202                         .tc_nthrs_init          = MGS_NTHRS_INIT,
01203                         .tc_nthrs_max           = MGS_NTHRS_MAX,
01204                         .tc_ctx_tags            = LCT_MG_THREAD,
01205                 },
01206                 .psc_ops                = {
01207                         .so_req_handler         = tgt_request_handle,
01208                         .so_req_printer         = target_print_req,
01209                 },
01210         };
01211 
01212         /* Start the service threads */
01213         mgs->mgs_service = ptlrpc_register_service(&conf, obd->obd_proc_entry);
01214         if (IS_ERR(mgs->mgs_service)) {
01215                 rc = PTR_ERR(mgs->mgs_service);
01216                 CERROR("failed to start mgs service: %d\n", rc);
01217                 mgs->mgs_service = NULL;
01218                 GOTO(err_lproc, rc);
01219         }
01220 
01221         ping_evictor_start();
01222 
01223         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "MGS %s started\n", obd->obd_name);
01224 
01225         /* device stack is not yet fully setup to keep no objects behind */
01226         lu_site_purge(env, mgs2lu_dev(mgs)->ld_site, ~0);
01227         RETURN(0);
01228 err_lproc:
01229         mgs_params_fsdb_cleanup(env, mgs);
01230         lproc_mgs_cleanup(mgs);
01231 err_llog:
01232         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01233         if (ctxt) {
01234                 ctxt->loc_dir = NULL;
01235                 llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
01236         }
01237 err_tgt:
01238         tgt_fini(env, &mgs->mgs_lut);
01239 err_fs:
01240         /* No extra cleanup needed for llog_init_commit_thread() */
01241         mgs_fs_cleanup(env, mgs);
01242 err_ns:
01243         ldlm_namespace_free(obd->obd_namespace, NULL, 0);
01244         obd->obd_namespace = NULL;
01245 err_ops:
01246         lu_site_purge(env, mgs2lu_dev(mgs)->ld_site, ~0);
01247         if (!cfs_hash_is_empty(mgs2lu_dev(mgs)->ld_site->ls_obj_hash)) {
01248                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
01249                 lu_site_print(env, mgs2lu_dev(mgs)->ld_site, &msgdata,
01250                                 lu_cdebug_printer);
01251         }
01252         obd_disconnect(mgs->mgs_bottom_exp);
01253 err_lmi:
01254         if (lmi)
01255                 server_put_mount(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0), true);
01256         RETURN(rc);
01257 }
01258 
01259 static struct lu_device *mgs_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
01260                                          struct lu_device *lu)
01261 {
01262         struct mgs_device *mgs = lu2mgs_dev(lu);
01263         ENTRY;
01264 
01265         dt_device_fini(&mgs->mgs_dt_dev);
01266         OBD_FREE_PTR(mgs);
01267         RETURN(NULL);
01268 }

01270 static int mgs_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
01271                               struct lu_device *dev,
01272                               struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01273 {
01274         LBUG();
01275         return 0;
01276 }
01277 
01278 static int mgs_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o,
01279                            const struct lu_object_conf *unused)
01280 {
01281         struct mgs_device *d = lu2mgs_dev(o->lo_dev);
01282         struct lu_device  *under;
01283         struct lu_object  *below;
01284         int                rc = 0;
01285         ENTRY;
01286 
01287         /* do no set .do_ops as mgs calls to bottom osd directly */
01288 
01289         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "object init, fid = "DFID"\n",
01290                         PFID(lu_object_fid(o)));
01291 
01292         under = &d->mgs_bottom->dd_lu_dev;
01293         below = under->ld_ops->ldo_object_alloc(env, o->lo_header, under);
01294         if (below != NULL)
01295                 lu_object_add(o, below);
01296         else
01297                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01298 
01299         return 0;
01300 }
01301 
01302 static void mgs_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
01303 {
01304         struct mgs_object *obj = lu2mgs_obj(o);
01305         struct lu_object_header *h = o->lo_header;
01306 
01307         dt_object_fini(&obj->mgo_obj);
01308         lu_object_header_fini(h);
01309         OBD_FREE_PTR(obj);
01310 }
01311 
01312 static int mgs_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
01313                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *l)
01314 {
01315         const struct mgs_object *o = lu2mgs_obj((struct lu_object *) l);
01316 
01317         return (*p)(env, cookie, LUSTRE_MGS_NAME"-object@%p", o);
01318 }

01320 static struct lu_object_operations mgs_lu_obj_ops = {
01321         .loo_object_init        = mgs_object_init,
01322         .loo_object_free        = mgs_object_free,
01323         .loo_object_print       = mgs_object_print,
01324 };
01325 
01326 static struct lu_object *mgs_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01327                                           const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
01328                                           struct lu_device *d)
01329 {
01330         struct lu_object_header *h;
01331         struct mgs_object       *o;
01332         struct lu_object        *l;
01333 
01334         LASSERT(hdr == NULL);
01335 
01336         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(o);
01337         if (o != NULL) {
01338                 l = &o->mgo_obj.do_lu;
01339                 h = &o->mgo_header;
01340 
01341                 lu_object_header_init(h);
01342                 dt_object_init(&o->mgo_obj, h, d);
01343                 lu_object_add_top(h, l);
01344 
01345                 l->lo_ops = &mgs_lu_obj_ops;
01346 
01347                 return l;
01348         } else {
01349                 return NULL;
01350         }
01351 }
01352 
01353 const struct lu_device_operations mgs_lu_ops = {
01354         .ldo_object_alloc       = mgs_object_alloc,
01355         .ldo_process_config     = mgs_process_config,
01356 };
01357 
01358 static struct lu_device *mgs_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01359                                           struct lu_device_type *type,
01360                                           struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01361 {
01362         struct mgs_device *mgs;
01363         struct lu_device  *ludev;
01364 
01365         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(mgs);
01366         if (mgs == NULL) {
01367                 ludev = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01368         } else {
01369                 int rc;
01370 
01371                 ludev = mgs2lu_dev(mgs);
01372                 dt_device_init(&mgs->mgs_dt_dev, type);
01373                 rc = mgs_init0(env, mgs, type, lcfg);
01374                 if (rc != 0) {
01375                         mgs_device_free(env, ludev);
01376                         ludev = ERR_PTR(rc);
01377                 }
01378         }
01379         return ludev;
01380 }
01381 
01382 static struct lu_device *mgs_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
01383                                          struct lu_device *d)
01384 {
01385         struct mgs_device       *mgs = lu2mgs_dev(d);
01386         struct obd_device       *obd = mgs->mgs_obd;
01387         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01388 
01389         ENTRY;
01390 
01391         LASSERT(mgs->mgs_bottom);
01392 
01393         class_disconnect_exports(obd);
01394 
01395         ping_evictor_stop();
01396 
01397         mutex_lock(&mgs->mgs_health_mutex);
01398         ptlrpc_unregister_service(mgs->mgs_service);
01399         mutex_unlock(&mgs->mgs_health_mutex);
01400 
01401         mgs_params_fsdb_cleanup(env, mgs);
01402         mgs_cleanup_fsdb_list(mgs);
01403 
01404         ldlm_namespace_free_prior(obd->obd_namespace, NULL, 1);
01405         obd_exports_barrier(obd);
01406         obd_zombie_barrier();
01407 
01408         tgt_fini(env, &mgs->mgs_lut);
01409         lproc_mgs_cleanup(mgs);
01410 
01411         ctxt = llog_get_context(mgs->mgs_obd, LLOG_CONFIG_ORIG_CTXT);
01412         if (ctxt) {
01413                 ctxt->loc_dir = NULL;
01414                 llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
01415         }
01416 
01417         mgs_fs_cleanup(env, mgs);
01418 
01419         ldlm_namespace_free_post(obd->obd_namespace);
01420         obd->obd_namespace = NULL;
01421 
01422         lu_site_purge(env, d->ld_site, ~0);
01423         if (!cfs_hash_is_empty(d->ld_site->ls_obj_hash)) {
01424                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
01425                 lu_site_print(env, d->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
01426         }
01427 
01428         LASSERT(mgs->mgs_bottom_exp);
01429         obd_disconnect(mgs->mgs_bottom_exp);
01430 
01431         server_put_mount(obd->obd_name, true);
01432 
01433         RETURN(NULL);
01434 }

01437 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(mgs, struct mgs_thread_info);
01438 
01439 LU_TYPE_INIT_FINI(mgs, &mgs_thread_key);
01440 
01441 LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(mgs, LCT_MG_THREAD);

01460         .ldt_ctx_tags   = LCT_MG_THREAD

01463 static int mgs_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
01464                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01465                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
01466 {
01467         struct obd_export       *lexp;
01468         struct lustre_handle     conn = { 0 };
01469         int                      rc;
01470 
01471         ENTRY;
01472 
01473         if (exp == NULL || obd == NULL || cluuid == NULL)
01474                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01475 
01476         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
01477         if (rc)
01478                 RETURN(rc);
01479 
01480         lexp = class_conn2export(&conn);
01481         if (lexp == NULL)
01482                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
01483 
01484         if (data != NULL) {
01485                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= MGS_CONNECT_SUPPORTED;
01486                 data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01487                 lexp->exp_connect_data = *data;
01488         }
01489 
01490         tgt_counter_incr(lexp, LPROC_MGS_CONNECT);
01491 
01492         rc = mgs_export_stats_init(obd, lexp, localdata);
01493         if (rc)
01494                 class_disconnect(lexp);
01495         else
01496                 *exp = lexp;
01497 
01498         RETURN(rc);
01499 }
01500 
01501 static int mgs_obd_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01502                              struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01503                              struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
01504 {
01505         ENTRY;
01506 
01507         if (exp == NULL || obd == NULL || cluuid == NULL)
01508                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01509 
01510         tgt_counter_incr(exp, LPROC_MGS_CONNECT);
01511 
01512         if (data != NULL) {
01513                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= MGS_CONNECT_SUPPORTED;
01514                 data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01515                 exp->exp_connect_data = *data;
01516         }
01517 
01518         RETURN(mgs_export_stats_init(obd, exp, localdata));
01519 }
01520 
01521 static int mgs_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
01522 {
01523         int rc;
01524 
01525         ENTRY;
01526 
01527         LASSERT(exp);
01528 
01529         mgs_fsc_cleanup(exp);
01530 
01531         class_export_get(exp);
01532         tgt_counter_incr(exp, LPROC_MGS_DISCONNECT);
01533 
01534         rc = server_disconnect_export(exp);
01535         class_export_put(exp);
01536         RETURN(rc);
01537 }
01538 
01539 static int mgs_health_check(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd)
01540 {
01541         struct mgs_device *mgs = lu2mgs_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01542         int rc = 0;
01543 
01544         mutex_lock(&mgs->mgs_health_mutex);
01545         rc |= ptlrpc_service_health_check(mgs->mgs_service);
01546         mutex_unlock(&mgs->mgs_health_mutex);
01547 
01548         return rc != 0 ? 1 : 0;
01549 }
01550 
01551 /* use obd ops to offer management infrastructure */
01552 static struct obd_ops mgs_obd_device_ops = {
01553         .o_owner                = THIS_MODULE,
01554         .o_connect              = mgs_obd_connect,
01555         .o_reconnect            = mgs_obd_reconnect,
01556         .o_disconnect           = mgs_obd_disconnect,
01557         .o_init_export          = mgs_init_export,
01558         .o_destroy_export       = mgs_destroy_export,
01559         .o_iocontrol            = mgs_iocontrol,
01560         .o_health_check         = mgs_health_check,
01561 };
01562 
01563 static int __init mgs_init(void)
01564 {
01565         return class_register_type(&mgs_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
01566                                    LUSTRE_MGS_NAME, &mgs_device_type);
01567 }

01570 {
01571         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_MGS_NAME);
01572 }
